data.title: Extremely helpful
data.text: Knowledgeable, friendly, and seemed themselves (even the two young women who helped us) to know a lot about local fishing conditions, hiking, and where to go. We didn't take any of  their guides or anything, just the store and chatting. Great place! Good advice, nice array of flies, tackle, clothing, you name it.

data.title: Caught a Brookie
data.text: This was the second time I've fished with this outfitter. Guide picked me up at my hotel, took me to the shop to get outfitted. Nice shop with all top notch gear. I'm a novice fly fisherman, so the point of the venture was instructional, but the guide put me on the fish! I had caught four within the first two hours on the water. Great for me. Guide was very informative of my technique, helping gain confidence. Well worth the price for the knowledge and sheer beauty that I experienced

data.title: Take my husband, please ;)
data.text:
Planned a great girls trip to Boulder - and guess who joined us!? Hubby! 
Rocky Mountain Anglers SAVED THE DAY! Tyler did a great job keeping hubby happy on the beautiful rivers and streams around Boulder! They caught both Browns and Rainbows and saw the beautiful, natural beauty of Boulder while the girls and I enjoyed the pool and Pearl Street! ❤️Thanks Tyler! You rock! And thanks too, for texting me this great pic of the happy hubby himself, wader-clad and smiling ear to ear! 
Ladies, this is a great gift for your guy, too!!

data.title: Great first visit
data.text: I am a casual fisherman.  I stopped in to learn more of ways to improve and enjoy fishing more.  They have a variety of free classes, group classes and individual instruction and guiding that I will be pursuing.  The staff was enthusiastic and helpful.  I will return!

data.title: their
data.text: spoke to sales person about fishing lessons they have a lot of stuff for fresh water trout  .im looking forward to the season to start.

data.title: Great day!!
data.text:
What a great way to see some of Colorado! We did the 6 hr excursion leading us to the national park. We had a blast. Staff was great, lunch was big, guide was amazing!
We caught a few small fish, but were offered a scenic less-fish option, or the opposite. We got what we asked for and had a great time!

data.title: Flyfishing the Rocky Mountains!
data.text: My husband is an avid fly fisherman and we stopped in to Rocky Mountain Anglers on a very busy Saturday in December to look around and discuss the local streams.  The shop manager, Brian, was very friendly and helpful and seemed to be the 'go to' expert on all things 'flyfishing'! He's quite knowledgeable about the specific gear they carry (upscale & excellent as well as basic and fundamental, a good all around shop for 'choice') and knew what fish were biting and when.  We've since checked out their website, it's over the top, too, and loaded with information.  This shop should be on the Top Ten places to visit in Boulder (for flyfishing enthusiasts, that is).  The coffee was on, the shop dogs friendly and the whole ambiance was cozy and comfortable.    Also, must mention that they have FREE classes on just about everything all the time although we didn't get to attend anything the week we were in town.

data.title: Great Guided Fly-fishing Trip
data.text: Randy runs a great business and has great guides for the novice to expert fly-fisherman.  My husband and I wanted to learn and had a great guide in Chris.  This business also sponsors the University of Colorado Fly-fishing Team.
